intro: Elatostema laxicymosum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed elatostema, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or along stream banks. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Elatostema laxicymosum is often found in rocky or clay soils and is adapted to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
